io.hekate.metrics.statsd

Class StatsdMetricsPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.hekate.metrics.statsd.StatsdMetricsPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Plugin

    public class StatsdMetricsPlugin
extends Object
implements Plugin
    « start hereStatsD metrics publisher plugin.

    Overview

    This plugin provides support for publishing metrics from LocalMetricsService to StatsD.

    Metrics are asynchronously published once per LocalMetricsServiceFactory.setRefreshInterval(long) interval. On each tick the snapshot of current metrics is placed into a bounded queue of StatsdMetricsConfig.setMaxQueueSize(int) size. If queue is full (i.e. publishing is slow due to some networking issues) then new metrics are dropped until there is more space in the queue.

    All metrics are published via UDP protocol. Each UDP packet can contain no more than StatsdMetricsConfig.setBatchSize(int) metrics. If the size of a metrics snapshot is greater than this value then snapshot will be split into multiple UPD packets.

    Module dependency

    StatsD support is provided by the 'hekate-metrics-statsd' module and can be imported into the project dependency management system as in the example below:

    • Maven
    • Gradle
    • Ivy
    
 <dependency>
   <groupId>io.hekate</groupId>
   <artifactId>hekate-metrics-statsd</artifactId>
   <version>2.4.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
 </dependency>
 
    
 compile group: 'io.hekate', name: 'hekate-metrics-statsd', version: '2.4.0-SNAPSHOT'
 
    
 <dependency org="io.hekate" name="hekate-metrics-statsd" rev="2.4.0-SNAPSHOT"/>

    Configuration

    Configuration options of this plugin are represented by the StatsdMetricsConfig class. Please see the documentation of its properties for more details.

    Registering plugin

    This plugin can be registered via HekateBootstrap.setPlugins(List) method as in the example below:

    1) Prepare plugin configuration with StatsD connectivity options. 

    
StatsdMetricsConfig statsdCfg = new StatsdMetricsConfig()
    .withHost("my-statsd-host-or-ip-address")
    .withPort(8125);

    2) Register plugin and start new node. 

    
Hekate node = new HekateBootstrap()
    .withPlugin(new StatsdMetricsPlugin(statsdCfg))
    .join();

    Metrics names and tags

    Metric names are escaped so that all characters that are not letters, digits or dots (.) are replaced with underscores (_).

    Metrics filtering

    It is possible to filter out metrics that should not be published to StatsD by registering an instance of MetricFilter interface. Only those metrics that do match the specified filter will be published to StatsD.

    See Also:
    StatsdMetricsConfig, HekateBootstrap.setPlugins(List)
